wikipedia_page.main: Olga Florence Edwardes Davenport (c. 1915 – 23 July 2008) was a South African-born British actress and artist, born in c. 1915.

response: Irene Adler was played by Olga Edwardes in the episode "A Scandal in Bohemia" in the 1951 TV series Sherlock Holmes.
The story was adapted for a 1951 TV episode of We Present Alan Wheatley as Mr Sherlock Holmes in... starring Alan Wheatley as Holmes, Raymond Francis as Dr. Watson and Olga Edwardes as Irene Adler.
The cast consisted of Reginald Brooke, Zoe Davies, Olga Edwardes, Wilfred Fletcher, Neil Porter, Hilary Pritchard, Henry Belling and Ben Soutten.Condemned To Be Shot at the Internet Movie Database
|The Six Men||Michael Law||Harold Warrender, Olga Edwardes||Crime||

Black Orchid is a 1953 British mystery film directed by Charles Saunders and starring Ronald Howard, Olga Edwardes, and John Bentley. The screenplay concerns a doctor who is implicated in the death of his wife which allowed him to marry her sister.
* Olga Edwardes (1917–2008) British-South African actress and artist

link_mentions.page: The Angel with the Trumpet (1950 film)

response: In multiple episodes, Iris Vandeleur played Mrs. Hudson and Bill Owen played Inspector Lestrade. Eric Maturin appeared as Colonel Moran in one episode, and Olga Edwardes portrayed Irene Adler in another episode.
* Olga Edwardes as Irene Adler (1 episode)

The Six Men is a 1951 British crime film directed by Michael Law and starring Harold Warrender, Olga Edwardes and Peter Bull. It was made by the independent Vandyke Productions at the Riverside Studios in Hammersmith. It also used location shooting around London.Chibnall & McFarlane p.122

It premiered at the New Theatre, Oxford before tranferring to the Apollo Theatre in London's West End where it ran for 268 performances between 12 June 1946 and 1 February 1947. The original West End cast included Leslie Banks, Hermione Baddeley, Frederick Lloyd, Olga Edwardes, Campbell Copelin and Vincent Holman.Wearing p.239 It was revived briefly at the Theatre Royal Stratford East in 1948, lasting for 16 performances.Wearing p.353
